IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of the Vermont Student Development Fund is to seek, invest and maintain monetary and other support for scholarships and other financial assistance to individuals seeking a post secondary education or training.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Vermont Scholarship Fund is a 501(c)(3) charitable affiliate of the Vermont Student Assistance Corporation. Our mission is to provide scholarships to Vermonters through gifts from individual donors and philanthropic sources. Together with our Donors we make it possible for more Vermonters to aim higher, go further, and build something better for themselves, for their families, for their community, and for our shared world. We partner closely with our donors to create scholarship funds that reflect their personal and philanthropic values as well as their financial goals, so they can help open the doors to higher education for others. We administer all scholarships through VSAC, with ongoing support that makes managing a scholarship easy. VSAC currently awards about $10.0 million in scholarships through 124 award programs to 3,821 Vermonters.
IRS990.Desc: Scholarships were awarded and disbursed to 3,821 students to support their pursuit of higher education.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VP of Outreach, HR, and CIO
VP of Financial Aid Services and Research
Vice Chair & Programs & Services Comm. Chair

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization's endowment funds are used as directed by the donors to hold, invest, and provide scholarships for the higher education of Vermont students.

The awarding of scholarships by VSDF is performed by its related organization VSAC to insure that all funds are awarded and disbursed in accordance with the donors' directives. VSAC maintains a complete staff of experts in its Grants and Scholarships departments using the latest information technologies to insure the quality of the process. Additionally, all funds received from Federal programs are subject to VSAC's annual Uniform Guidance Single Audit process. Certain of the larger private programs are audited at those donors' request, and all scholarship expenditures are open to inspection by the donors. Additionally, except for a few cases of donor preference, VSDF awards are disbursed directly to the higher education institution selected by the recipient. In the few cases where this is not the donors' wish VSDF and VSAC work to encourage this practice.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: VP of Financial Aid Services and Research
VP of Outreach, HR, and CIO

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VSDF's CEO is recruited, employed and compensated by a related organization, the Vermont Student Assistance Corporation (VSAC). This related organization uses the following to establish and document the compensation of the CEO: compensation survey, written employment contract, and approval of the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: For the year ending 6/30/2023 the Board of Directors of VSDF did not review the form 990 prior to filing. This return was prepared by senior accounting staff. It was reviewed by the Vice President of Finance/CFO and the Vice President-Legal Counsel. It was made available to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors prior to filing and was approved by this committee. Additionally it was made available to the full Board of Directors for review and comment prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: On an annual basis each Board member and officer is required to complete a questionnaire disclosing any relationships which might violate the Organization's policy regarding conflicts of interest. In the event such a conflict were to exist the Organization would conduct a follow-up investigation and take appropriate steps to insure that the conflict relationship did not continue or persist.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VSDF is governed by the policies and decisions of the Vermont Student Assistance Corporation (VSAC) and is a component unit of that entity. Consequently the financial statements of VSDF are consolidated with those of VSAC. The consolidated annual audited financial statements of VSAC are available on the website www.vsac.org. Quarterly unaudited financial statements of VSDF are also available at this same site. VSAC's and VSDF's governing documents and conflicts of interest policy are public records of the State of Vermont and will be made available upon request.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Counseling and financial assistance to post secondary Vermont students
